content: Good analysis, but you didn’t mention something that I thought you would. Apple, Inc. seems to have forgotten that it used to be Apple Computer, Inc. First it gave up its server computer (although you could argue that the line of servers wasn’t necessary, since their server software was probably running on more Mac minis and Mac Pros than the servers). Next, the last updates of the Mac mini and the Mac Pro haven’t been impressive (the latest mini would not allow a memory upgrade since it only came with hard wired RAM). Apple seemed to have forgotten that the mini was to entice Windows users to switch, but if they wanted a decent amount of RAM, they would be better off buying an iMac or staying with a Windows machine. What is really hurting the computer business is the “newest” Mac mini and Mac Pro are a couple years old. https://buyersguide.macrumors.com/#MacBook The promises of new desktop computers are too vague to plan purchases with.
